title: Sri Lanka stocks up in mid-day trade
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka stock market moved up 0.7 percent within the first hour of trade on Friday (27) recovering from the previous session’s fall, Colombo Stock Exchange data showed.
The main All Share Price Index gained 0.67 percent or 55.92 points to 8,375.50.

“We saw mixed reactions in the market today. There is both selling pressure coming in on the banking and finance shares while there are positive sentiments from the plantation sector,” a top market analyst said.
“The IMF concluding their 16-day discussion too has acted negatively in the market.”
The most liquid index S&P SL20, after hovering in red gained 0.57 percent or 15.77 points to 2,760.31
